alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 23 at 8:51PM EST until December 24 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rain and significant snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Coastal DownEast, Far Eastern, Interior DownEast, and Penobscot Valley Maine, including the following areas, in Central Highlands Maine, Central Piscataquis and Southern Piscataquis. In Coastal DownEast Maine, Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington. In Far Eastern Maine, Northern Washington. In Interior DownEast Maine, Central Washington and Interior Hancock. In Penobscot Valley Maine, Central Penobscot and Southern Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more rain and snowmelt. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An additional one half inch of rain is possible with storm totals of up to 3 inches. In addition, significant snow melt is expected in the Penobscot, Piscataquis and Downeast river basins. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
